polyethylene.intro: Polyethylene (PE) is the world's most produced plastic — over 100 million tonnes annually — used for packaging film, bottles, pipes, toys, and countless everyday items. Produced by polymerising ethylene monomer derived from cracking naphtha (oil-based) or ethane (natural-gas-based). Two main grades: HDPE (high-density, rigid — milk jugs, pipes) and LDPE/LLDPE (low-density, flexible — stretch wrap, plastic bags). The US Gulf Coast and Middle East dominate production due to cheap ethane feedstock from shale gas and associated gas.

polypropylene.intro: Polypropylene (PP) is the world's second-most produced plastic, valued for its excellent chemical resistance, heat tolerance (microwaveable containers), light weight, and versatility. Produced by polymerising propylene monomer — a co-product of ethylene cracking or fluid catalytic cracking (FCC) in oil refineries. PP is used for automotive components, packaging, textiles (non-woven fabrics for masks and nappies), furniture, and medical devices. China is both the largest producer and consumer of PP.

polyvinyl.intro: PVC (polyvinyl chloride) is the world's third-most produced plastic, unique among major polymers because roughly 57% of its mass comes from chlorine (derived from common salt, NaCl) rather than petroleum. This makes PVC less oil-dependent than other plastics. Produced by polymerising vinyl chloride monomer (VCM). PVC comes in two forms: rigid (uPVC — pipes, window frames, profiles) and flexible (plasticised — cables, flooring, medical bags). China produces and consumes over 40% of global PVC. The construction industry consumes over 70% of PVC output.

monomer.enhancer: EDC cracking furnace tubes at 500°C, EDC decomposing into VCM and HCl, rapid quench to prevent further reaction, VCM distillation to polymer-grade purity, HCl being recycled to the oxychlorination reactor, safety monitoring for VCM exposure (classified carcinogen requiring strict containment)

environments._default: VCM production plant, EDC cracking, VCM purification, HCl recycling, safety-critical chemical operation due to VCM carcinogenicity, integrated PVC complex
environments.US: Gulf Coast VCM plant, strict EPA and OSHA monitoring for VCM emissions, fenceline community monitoring, American chemical safety regulation, Louisiana industrial corridor

polymerisation.subject: Suspension PVC reactor — large autoclave vessel where VCM is dispersed in water with suspending agents and polymerised by free-radical initiation, producing PVC powder grains suspended in water
polymerisation.lens: 35mm f/5.6, PVC plant reactor bay, tall autoclave reactor vessels in a row, VCM handling safety systems, batch polymerisation technology, the reactors that produce PVC resin
polymerisation.enhancer: Tall stainless-steel-lined autoclave reactor, VCM and water charged with suspending agent and initiator, exothermic reaction controlled by cooling water, batch reaction over 4-8 hours, reactor opened and PVC slurry discharged, strict VCM containment and recovery between batches

environments._default: PVC suspension polymerisation plant, batch autoclave reactors, VCM recovery, slurry processing, PVC drying, the resin production step
environments.US: Westlake or Shintech PVC plant in Louisiana, multiple reactors in parallel for continuous production, world-scale operation, Gulf Coast PVC corridor
environments.CN: Chinese PVC plant in Xinjiang or Inner Mongolia, often using calcium-carbide-acetylene route rather than ethylene-based VCM, coal-based PVC production unique to China, remote industrial zone

pelletising.subject: PVC resin drying and classification, white PVC powder being centrifuged, dried in a fluidised-bed dryer, and classified by particle size, producing the white powder that is the trade form of PVC resin — not pellets like PE and PP
pelletising.lens: 50mm f/4, PVC plant finishing section, white powder on conveyors and in silos, drying and classification, the trade product — PVC is sold as powder rather than pellets (unique among major plastics)
pelletising.enhancer: White PVC suspension resin powder being dried in the fluidised-bed, classified by particle size through vibrating screens, stored in silos, bagged in 25kg bags or loaded into bulk containers, PVC is unique in being traded as free-flowing powder rather than pellets, K-value and porosity specifications determining grade

environments._default: PVC resin finishing section, drying, classification, silo storage, bagging, the powder form that distinguishes PVC from pelletised PE and PP
environments.US: Shintech (Shin-Etsu subsidiary) PVC resin plant in Plaquemine, Louisiana, world's largest single-site PVC producer, white resin silos, railcar and truck loading, Gulf Coast chemical industry

compounding.subject: PVC dry-blend compounding in a high-speed mixer, white PVC resin being blended with heat stabilisers, lubricants, impact modifiers, pigments, and fillers to create a ready-to-process compound — the recipe that determines PVC's final properties
compounding.lens: 50mm f/4, compounding facility, high-speed hot-cold mixer combination, ingredient addition, the formulation step that transforms brittle PVC resin into a processable material
compounding.enhancer: High-speed mixer (Henschel type) heating PVC powder through frictional shear, calcium-zinc or tin stabiliser added, lubricant, calcium carbonate filler, impact modifier ACM or CPE, pigment for colour, hot compound dumped to cold mixer for cooling, dry blend ready for extrusion or further compounding into pellets

environments._default: PVC compounding facility, hot-cold mixer combination, ingredient metering, dry blend and pellet production, custom formulations for different applications
environments.US: American PVC compounder, rigid and flexible formulations, pipe compound for construction, flexible compound for wire and cable, Midwest or Southern US industrial setting
environments.CN: Chinese PVC compounder in Zhejiang or Guangdong, massive domestic PVC processing industry, formulations for pipe, profiles, and flooring, Chinese construction boom driving demand

forming.subject: PVC pipe extrusion line, white PVC compound being extruded through an annular die into a continuous pipe, passing through the sizing vacuum tank, haul-off, and saw, producing rigid uPVC pressure and drainage pipe
forming.lens: 35mm f/4, extrusion factory, pipe line stretching the length of the building, white PVC pipe emerging from the die and traveling through sizing, cooling, printing, cutting — the complete pipe production process visible in one shot
forming.enhancer: Molten PVC emerging from the annular die as a continuous pipe, vacuum sizing tank pulling the pipe to exact diameter, cooling tanks, haul-off caterpillar pulling the pipe at constant speed, inkjet printer marking size and standard, automatic saw cutting to length, pipe stacking at the end — the production line that supplies the construction industry

environments._default: PVC pipe extrusion factory, single-screw extruder, die, sizing, cooling, printing, cutting, stacking, the dominant PVC product for construction
environments.US: American PVC pipe extruder (JM Eagle or North American Pipe), pipe for water, sewer, and drainage, building code compliance markings, ASTM standards, American construction supply chain
environments.IN: Indian PVC pipe factory (Astral or Supreme), pipes for water supply and agriculture, rapid growth in Indian plumbing infrastructure, PVC replacing galvanised iron in Indian construction

product.subject: uPVC window profile system installed in a building, multi-chamber profile cross-section visible showing the engineering that provides insulation and structural strength, the construction product that dominates European fenestration
product.lens: 50mm f/4, construction product shot, PVC window installed in a building facade, profile cross-section detail visible showing the multi-chamber design, clean architectural context
product.enhancer: White uPVC window frame with visible multi-chamber profile cross-section, double or triple glazing sealed units, hardware and weathersealing, the profile system providing thermal insulation, structural strength, and zero maintenance, PVC's dominant construction application in European and Asian markets

environments._default: Residential building with PVC windows installed, clean white profiles, maintenance-free fenestration, the construction application consuming millions of tonnes of PVC annually
environments.DE: German residential building with VEKA or Rehau uPVC triple-glazed windows, Passivhaus energy standard, white profiles in a traditional or modern facade, German building energy efficiency, PVC's energy-saving contribution through superior thermal insulation
environments.GB: British semi-detached house with replacement uPVC double glazing, the window replacement that transformed British housing from draughty to insulated, white PVC frames now ubiquitous in UK residential architecture
environments.CN: Chinese high-rise apartment with PVC-U windows, massive Chinese construction programme consuming PVC profiles, urban Chinese residential tower, the scale of Chinese PVC-window demand

distribution.subject: Hospital ward with PVC medical products visible everywhere — IV bags made from plasticised PVC, blood bags, oxygen tubing, flooring, wall cladding — PVC's critical role in healthcare infrastructure
distribution.lens: 35mm f/4, hospital interior, PVC medical products surrounding a patient bed, IV bags, tubing, flooring, all PVC, the healthcare application that relies on PVC's unique properties
distribution.enhancer: Flexible PVC IV bags hanging on a stand, clear PVC oxygen tubing, PVC-insulated monitoring cables, vinyl flooring for hygiene, PVC wall protection, blood bags made from specially formulated PVC — the hospital environment is one of PVC's most critical applications, medical-grade PVC enabling modern healthcare

environments._default: Hospital ward, PVC medical devices and building products visible throughout, the healthcare application demonstrating PVC's critical role in modern medicine
environments.US: American hospital ward, Baxter PVC IV bags, vinyl flooring, PVC cable insulation, the ubiquitous medical plastic that healthcare depends on, American hospital environment
environments.IN: Indian hospital, PVC blood bags and IV sets enabling rural healthcare expansion, affordable PVC medical devices extending modern medicine's reach, Indian healthcare improvement through plastics access

waste.subject: End-of-life PVC window frames being collected for recycling, old profiles removed during renovation being separated from glass and hardware, PVC's long product life (50+ years) meaning the waste stream is only now growing as early installations reach end of life
waste.lens: 35mm f/4, demolition or renovation site, old PVC windows being removed and stacked for recycling, the long-life product now entering its first major recycling phase
waste.enhancer: Old PVC window frames being removed from a renovation project, glass separated, hardware stripped, white PVC profiles stacked for collection, 30-50 years of service from these windows, PVC's durability both a virtue (long life) and challenge (eventually enters waste stream), first-generation PVC windows now reaching end of life across Europe

environments._default: Renovation or demolition site, PVC windows being removed for recycling, end-of-life PVC product collection, the beginning of the circular economy for long-life PVC products
environments.DE: German building renovation, REWINDO or Recovinyl collection of end-of-life PVC windows, German recycling leadership, systematic collection infrastructure, the circular economy for PVC profiles
environments.GB: British window replacement, old first-generation uPVC windows being removed (installed in the 1980s-90s), recycling collection skip, the first major wave of PVC window recycling in the UK

recycling.subject: PVC window profile recycling plant, old profiles being shredded, metal and rubber separated, PVC regrind being extruded into new profile or pipe — up to 10 recycling cycles possible for PVC without significant property loss
recycling.lens: 50mm f/4, recycling plant, PVC shredder and separation equipment, regrind extruder producing new product from old, the closed-loop recycling that PVC's thermoplastic nature enables
recycling.enhancer: Old PVC profiles being fed into the shredder, metal hardware and rubber gaskets separated by eddy current and density separators, clean white PVC regrind, extruder producing recycled PVC pellets or directly extruding new profiles or pipe with recycled PVC core and virgin PVC skin (co-extrusion), up to 10 recycling cycles without significant property loss, PVC's inherent recyclability

environments._default: PVC recycling plant, shredding, separation, regrind, extrusion of recycled PVC into new products, the mechanical recycling loop for PVC
environments.DE: VEKA Umwelttechnik recycling plant in Germany, old PVC windows ground and extruded into new profiles with recycled core, closed-loop German PVC recycling, Recovinyl system, European circular economy for PVC at commercial scale
environments.BE: Belgian PVC recycler, VinyLoop or mechanical recycling, processing collected PVC from across Europe, Antwerp chemical cluster, European PVC recycling hub
